website_summaries.verdict: These chisel-tipped markers write smoothly, and you get a lot of them for the price.
pros: Value pack of 32 markers in black, green, red, purple, and blue
Colors are easy to see from a distance and erase easily
Markers write smoothly and dry fast
cons: Reports that some dry out too quickly

customer_reviews.title: Waste of Money!
customer_reviews.text: I am a teacher in a inner city school. Students do not bring in their own school supplies so I end up buying them. These markers dry out quickly. This was a total waste of money to the point that I want to call EXPO to see if there is any way I can get my money back. Some of the caps were not tight on the markers so they were dry or close to dry right out of the box. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Teacher

customer_reviews.title: I really really really wanted to like these!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Because these are a well known product and the price was right..(I got them for a great deal at 5.88) I was thrilled to be able to order them. I am a teacher and admittedly use these daily. At least half of the colors are too light to be seen on a white board and the other half dried up really quickly. A couple of months into buying this product and I can only use the black and that horrible brown.
customer_reviews.author: kindle customer

customer_reviews.title: Dry as licking deodorant
customer_reviews.text: The arrived entirely dried out. Waste of my time. I'm annoyed by that because as a teacher, I do not use all of the colors at once, so why would I even think to test them? I tried to write on my white board at work and the first one was dry, okay I thought, I mixed it up with my old one.... nope, each one after the other was dry. :(
customer_reviews.author: CaCO3

customer_reviews.title: WARNING: Hard to return/refund.
customer_reviews.text: Red pen failed to write within minutes of first use. One or more pens failing seems to be a theme in these reviews. What makes this stand out is how difficult it is to get a replacement for a product with a clear history of problems. Default Amazon answer is not eligible for return, and wastes your time appealing. Would not recommend you buy this given the history of problems AND no support from Amazon in rectifying the issue easily.
customer_reviews.author: R. Gene Hertel

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed in the way this came in
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed in the way this came in. I opened my box and the markers were all out and it seems like someone already tore the box and just haphazardly taped it at the side. You can tell they tried to put it back in the box because some were upside down. Makes me wonder if some were already used or what. Will be returning.
customer_reviews.author: Ruby

customer_reviews.title: Markers were dried out upon arrival...
customer_reviews.text: I am a teacher who relies on dry erase markers. Expo markers are usually the best... when I saw the price on this deal, I was excited. SO disappointing... not sure how long these markers were in storage, but half of them were dried out and barely visible on my white board... not like Pink or Sky blue either. I'm talking RED, GREEN, ORANGE... colors that SHOULD be bright and vibrant... oh well... back to brick and mortar for this kind of purchase I guess...
customer_reviews.author: Esvelazquez73

customer_reviews.title: suffice to say I'm so satisfied with the purchase
customer_reviews.text: I am a visual person, so, I need to draw almost everything a read for school and learning purposes (molecular biology, signaling pathways, etc.), so, I painted my basement wall with a dry-erase paint, and after checking reviews, I decided to get this EXPO pack. Well, suffice to say I'm so satisfied with the purchase. No lines left, nothing on the wall. However, I followed the recommendation of one person's review, suggesting to get the EXPO white board care spray. That works GREAT!!!! My board it's SUPER clean. BTW, I used those microfiber towels that are used to clean the dust. That works very well. Great great choice. Really.
customer_reviews.author: Time Factory

customer_reviews.title: VERY LOW QUALITY MARKERS
customer_reviews.text: This is the second package I ordered and the markers ink is very very light. I was satisfied with My initial purchase, so I "reordered" the exact Sam England markers. The ink ran out quickly. Since this is a “buy it again” purchase, I expected the markers to be the same quality as previous purchase. Very disappointed and not going to waste my time returning. Attached picture shows the low quality dried up markers when compared to same color from a previous purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne J

customer_reviews.title: Most colors are dark enough/visible
customer_reviews.text: I saw a lot of reviews saying the colors were too light and you couldn’t see them but decided to give these a try anyway. All of the colors are bright and dark enough except for the light green and orange, but that is to be expected with those lighter colors. I was most concerned about the red because I use that color often when writing important things but I had no issue with it being too light like I saw in other pictures. No complaints so far, I just hope they actually last. Will update if they dry out quickly or lose brightness.
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: I normally love EXPO markers
customer_reviews.text: I normally love EXPO markers, but these are not the same quality as the ones that I have purchased in store. The ink in these markers appears faded and the tips are hard - as if they are dried out. I will not purchase these again.
customer_reviews.author: Nuin Giliath

customer_reviews.title: BUYER BEWARE
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT delay in opening your markers, even if you do not have an immediate need! I opened mine less than a week after the end date to return them and they are dry as a bone or very, very week. I never expected to have an issue as Expo is our brand of choice for our homeschool room. Just thought we would venture out and buy more colors.
customer_reviews.author: momof5

customer_reviews.title: I got them in perfect time. But when I took the pens out ...
customer_reviews.text: I was very excited to buys these expo dry erase pens. I got them in perfect time. But when I took the pens out and started using them I noticed the color was so off! They look like pastel colors which is not what I wanted. I was looking for the normal bold red and blues but what I got was washed out colors. The picture I have posted shows how off the colors are. From right to left ( orange, pink, red, brown, green, blue and purple) sadly the only two colors that really look right are blue and purple. I'm very disappointed I will not be ordering these ever again.
customer_reviews.author: Sandi G

customer_reviews.title: We love these markers.
customer_reviews.text: Expo is the brand my 8th header asks for when we order school supplies. They last the longest & write the best. These colors were an awesome variety and as a visual learner myself I know the value of having a wide selection as information seems to be more easily recalled in vivid color. Fair price and the packaging was nice because it allowed us to easily see exactly what we were ordering online.
customer_reviews.author: Thorne

customer_reviews.title: Not All Markers Work
customer_reviews.text: I use these markers for my job- I teach using white boards all day every day. Some of these markers are so light that you can’t see them more than a foot away. It almost seems like they’re so old that the ink becomes weak... I would save your money and run to Walmart or a different store instead of buying online. I would’ve returned them if I could but I didn’t realize any of this until I opened them and tried them. Great brand, something is wrong with these markers though. You can see the difference between store bought and amazon in the picture.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Dried out markers, Red were duds in six boxes.
customer_reviews.text: The red markers were dry on six boxes of these. They definitely have some kind of environmental wear / freshness date. Not sure how they can fix these, but the others worked fine. All the reds were duds.
customer_reviews.author: HeavyLunchTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: This is the absolute worst purchase I have ever made! I should have paid more attention to "recent reviews", I would not have bought them. They are dry as can be, and that's only the ones that weren't "cracked" or "broke". This seller should be ashamed to sell such an awful product! I warn you, DO NOT PURCHASE THESE MARKERS!
customer_reviews.author: Tayyter

customer_reviews.title: Dried out
customer_reviews.text: I've used Expo markers for the last 5-6 years as a home schooler, haven't had any problems with them except for this order. A few were dried out upon arrival, and since it was only 2 of them I didn't bother returning. However, all the rest have dried out one by one over course of the last month, we just discovered two more this morning during school that have dried out. The caps seem to have changed, they don't fit on tightly like ones I've used in the past, and presumably contribute to the drying out. Unfortunately my return window was a month ago, otherwise I would return. Won't risk wasting more money purchasing this brand again.
customer_reviews.author: pkwitt

customer_reviews.title: I had issues with the Dark Red Marker, but it ended up being fine
customer_reviews.text: I haven't had any issues with these markers. I opened them up within 48 hours of receiving them and tested them all. All worked great with the exception of the maroon marker. I thought something was wrong with it when I first tested it as it was so dark it was almost black! I thought about returning it, but the more I used it, the lighter it became. Super weird, but it works now. I'd also recommend getting the spray as even after you've erased the marker, some of it is still legible on the board.
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Blue stains the board and green is almost impossible to erase
customer_reviews.text: Some of the blue markers smear and stain the whiteboard and some of the green ones just wont erase and have to be scrubbed off. Very disappointed. Not sure if I can return these since the box has been opened.
customer_reviews.author: JV

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for white board writing!
customer_reviews.text: I love all the colors (black, purple, blue, green, and red). This was the perfect pack for a classroom, plenty of markers and these of course are the good quality, nice dark ink for seeing clearly on the board at good distances. I use these all day and they last long, maybe a couple months before I need to restock. The price was good for these, I'm always comparing because the sets of 8 or 10 in the store are too costly. Buy in bulk. The shipping was easy and fast, no problems. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Emily Toms

customer_reviews.title: Great deal!
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with this purchase. I bought a pack in November and they dried out in March. The kids at my job use them almost everyday so I was surprised they didn't dry out sooner. There are a few colors that look very similar, but that's not a big deal to me. I will definitely be buying again.
customer_reviews.author: Sirena

customer_reviews.title: Some are dry. The black one I used was okay.
customer_reviews.text: I used these today for the first day of school. They haven't been opened, but several are already dried out. The red are showing up as pink on my white board. I'm really disappointed as I had to spend my own money on them.
customer_reviews.author: Bel B

customer_reviews.title: INFERIOR QUALITY
customer_reviews.text: Some of the markers were somewhat dried out (i.e. ink not as dark as expected) and some of the caps were impossible to get off/on. Out of the 12 markers, I'd say about half seemed to be a lower quality than normal EXPO markers. Wonder if this 12-pk is offered for a lower price than the retail price because the company mixes in some poorer quality markers? Disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: Quality markers
customer_reviews.text: I needed several hundred dry erase markers so I bought s few different brands to compare. The Expo markers are not the cheapest but they are not crazy more money than other brands I looked at either. The quality of these if pretty decent. Nice dark bold colors with minimal streaking. Just one brand I tried had a few colors I liked more the the Expo brand. I have not had them long enough to know how long they last or do over time.
customer_reviews.author: B.W.

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: Came in a very large envelope. Opened on Christmas morning. Several markers had been bumped out of their box, and a few had caps that weren't completely snapped shut, which ruins dry erase markers. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Baughley

customer_reviews.title: Not Usable for Whole Class Instruciton
customer_reviews.text: Although, these markers can be used for small group instruction due to close proximity. These dry erase markers are very light and cannot be seen on the whiteboard by the students sitting in the back of the classroom. I do not recommend these dry erase markers. They are not returnable so I will give them to students to use for personal use.
customer_reviews.author: michael mccarty

customer_reviews.title: dry markers
customer_reviews.text: This is the second order of expo markers we have received with dry markers and I didn't worry the first time because this hadn't happened before. The first package had a dry pink and red, yet the pink seemed to do better as it got older...weird. However, THIS package had a dry orange, brown, and red. Very disappointing considering I pay the extra cost for the EXPO brand expecting a better product and better quality control. I am hopeful that these colors will also "get better with age" but I will be looking into other brands again. sigh...
customer_reviews.author: Michael Savelyev

customer_reviews.title: Not good
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure if these are old markers that Amazon is delivering or they've been stored in a hot warehouse... But these markers are mostly dried out and don't work for more than a week or two after you open them. Some markers were dried out the first time I tried to use them. Other markers worked okay for the first few days and then gradually dried out to the point that they were unusable after a week or so. Either way it's totally unacceptable. I've bought expo markers from the store and never had this problem. But this is the second package of dried out expo markers we've received from Amazon. I don't recommend buying from them.
customer_reviews.author: LC

customer_reviews.title: NONE OF THEM WRITE
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a friend that teaches a class on Sundays and to his surprise none of them worked.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Sandoval

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware!!  A real disappointment!
customer_reviews.text: I am a college professor and bought these for use in my classrooms. I don't write all that much in any particular class. Despite this fact, these markers lasted, on average, two weeks under normal use. Additionally, the red markers (of which there are 8) ARE IMPOSSIBLE to read from more than 3 feet away. So I really didn't buy 36 markers, I only bought 28, with the 8 reds going completely unused. I could not, in good conscience, recommend these markers to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Gburg Mark

customer_reviews.title: Great markers! Don’t let old reviews sway you from buying these
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these to use in a classroom. Have not had any issues with the markers being dull in color. A majority of the top reviews right now were written in 2018 or prior and many state the markers were bad. I was a little hesitant to buy at first due to these reviews but have been very pleased so far. Perhaps there was a manufacturing problem at that particular time. A majority of the recent reviews indicate the previous issues may have been addressed over time. No damage to packaging as other reviewers have noted. Would recommend buying!
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: 8-Blue, 8-black, 8-red, 8-green and 4-Purple markers?!
customer_reviews.text: When I opened the package, the top of this Expo erase box was missing and the markers were scattered all over the box. The original box was so flimsy I had to tape it together to have a holder for the markers. It also would have made sense to provide the same number of each marker color, instead of only 4 purple (8Blue, 8 black, 8 red, 8 green and 4 Purple?!) Solution: add 4 more purple markers and charge a little extra maybe?? Now I have to go out and buy 4 purple so I can have equal amounts of every color to divide out to the rooms they were intended for...
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Harrison

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: I do a lot of whiteboarding for prospects and customers as we engineer solutions for their environment. Nobody ever has more than two working markers if they even have two. So I carry my own. I used to buy Amazon Basics, but they would seem to dry out prematurely, especially the less used colors which was weird. Bought these this time and they are notch above what I used to get. Awesome having 8 colors at my disposal. They are cheap enough that I can leave them behind if I have too.
customer_reviews.author: mdisher

customer_reviews.title: They Don't Work
customer_reviews.text: I got these markers because I wanted the different colors for differentiating topics but 10 out of the 12 markers either wrote poorly or not at all. If I could give them a lower rating, I would. I contacted Amazon and they were great about it. They will send me a replacement pack, so hopefully, these aren't defective. UPDATE: I received replacement markers and 1 or 2 of the markers worked for a brief period of time. The rest were dry. These markers suck.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Capelle

customer_reviews.title: Some colors are too light to be visible.
customer_reviews.text: Some colors are too light to be visible, such as red, orange, and light green. See the photo attached (color names might be inaccurate as I am not good with colors). These markers were freshly out of the package which was delivered today. They do have low odor. But I was disappointed at their performance.
customer_reviews.author: Yada Yada Yada

customer_reviews.title: Fast shipping but weak ink. Boo.
customer_reviews.text: They arrived on time, but only 4 pens seemed good. The other10 pens were like the old pens I've got and have been using for a while but are now weak. If I had mixed these new ones up with my old pens, I wouldn't have been able to tell the difference. Too much hassle to return. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: AlisaD

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: The red in this packet looks more like a bright orange and not like a dark red like I have seen before. Not sure what is wrong with it but the rest of the markers are great.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Don't Buy These!
customer_reviews.text: My team bought a box of these for our new dry erase boards and almost half of them have been dried out and not useable. The second half gets about half of what I would expect a marker to do and they fade almost immediately. Very disappointed in this purchase but no way to return them or replace them according to customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Harper

customer_reviews.title: Proven product awesome product great manufacturer
customer_reviews.text: Long time buyer of these, classic name in the office space, or in your home as mine are used. Just make sure to keep the Caps snug and when you think you've either pushed in a chisel tip get a pair of needle-nose pliers to pull them out gently and if you think the ink is getting low just flip the marker upside down with cap on for about 2 days and you'll be fine. Meaning these are awesome markers and can last you a year depending on your usage
customer_reviews.author: mike000mike

customer_reviews.title: Nice darkness and colors
customer_reviews.text: I got these with clear pocket sheets for my toddler to trace letters and draw. They are very dark and have nice colors. My only issue is that the chisel tip makes it hard for him to draw so he switches hands a lot. He is only 4 and still learning how to hold markers. I asked him if he wanted different markers but he liked these. They wipe off with dry paper towel easily. I would rebuy except without the chisel tip to make it easier for him,
customer_reviews.author: Christopher J

customer_reviews.title: NOPE
customer_reviews.text: All dried up. At first, I thought it was a purchase from elsewhere, but then figured out it was from Amazon. At first, took one black out of the box and went on to write. Nada. Moved on to two other black ones and nada! Blues were kind of hit or miss. Reds are not as bright. A bit “watery”? Overall, it was a bad purchase and by the time I get it all returned, Office Depot came through and I went on with my life.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: excellent for teachers
customer_reviews.text: As a classroom teacher, these markers are one of the most important supplies that I use every day. When they were on sale for only $8 a pack, I bought 2. There is a wide selection of bright colors as well as neutrals. They last a long time and are easy to see on the board. So far I have only gone through 3 markers in the whole school year. At this rate, 2 packs will last me years! Many classroom supplies I like to purchase at Dollar tree to save $$, but not markers. The cheap dollar store markers fade out too quick. It's worth getting these expo markers, especially when on sale. Highly recommended
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Colorful!
customer_reviews.text: A wonderful assortment of colors. Two black, two red, two dark blue, two dark green, and eight variety colors. I have a large dry erase easel at home, for homeschooling, and these colors make it possible to do graphs and charts, and add some dimension to otherwise dull projects. For fun, my family and I use them to play games like Pictionary and Win, Lose, or Draw. In addition, the low-odor is nice because sometimes strong odors trigger migraine. Haven't had an issue, as I can barely even smell them.
customer_reviews.author: kaioh75

customer_reviews.title: I love all the colors I can't wait to use them ...
customer_reviews.text: I love all the colors I can't wait to use them I'm bored. My husband made it's beautiful I'm so excited I believe that you would love all of them too instead of just the original colors. I love the bright colors it's beautifu,l buy some you'll love it!
customer_reviews.author: Sheryl Franklin

customer_reviews.title: Love all the colors
customer_reviews.text: I am a teacher, so when the corona virus hit I bought these to use on a whiteboard in my home. They are still going strong a few moths later. I didn't use them every day though, like one would in a regular classroom because of the wonderful whiteboard that is on Zoom itself. I loved that there were so many colors though. Can't wait to use them again next year. P.s. I'm not sure what it meant by "sheerness." The markers are dark, as they are supposed to be.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Hirth

customer_reviews.title: disappointed
customer_reviews.text: These markers were all dried up and barely write on my white board. I am extremely disappointed and won't order again. I am not a "returner" so I will eat the cost and buy some more at the local office supply store =(
customer_reviews.author: JChap

customer_reviews.title: I was disappointed with a single marker in my set
customer_reviews.text: They are dry-erase markers. I was disappointed with a single marker in my set. The red marker marks so light, it is like a pale pink. The rest were fine, so i guess that marker is a dud. But red was one of the colors i needed the most. Anyhow, ended up switching it out with an office mate that had 2 red markers. Other than that, they work fine.
customer_reviews.author: Isaiah Carmona

customer_reviews.title: I love these markers
customer_reviews.text: These markers are great. I use a whiteboard for most of my engineering classes in college, and these markers last a long time and work great. Once you get towards the end, make sure you store them vertical so that the ink will soak into the tip. If a tip is dried out from the start, it is very simple to take some pliers and pull the tip out and flip it around so that the moist side is able to be used. These are the only dry-erase markers that I use. Plus, the high-vis colors are absolutely AMAZING.
customer_reviews.author: Shane Pender

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Pretty disappointed in this purchase because most of the markers were dried out. The black one was the only color that was vibrant. In the picture is how the marker colored just after opening. I know Expo is a good brand so I'm not really sure what happened. It's possible this isn't the actual Expo brand but a knockoff.
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: These colors are not what they used to be. I feel like something changed very noticeablely when I compare these with the old ones I have of the same label. The color that comes out doesn't even match what's on the outsides. It's like they lost a the vibrancy or something. I dislike almost every color in this back now, and I still have my markers from the Same pack I bought years ago to compare them to so I know they're different.
customer_reviews.author: Brittney

customer_reviews.title: Bad purchase. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.text: Bad purchase. Black markers writes in gray. Dried out Photo Top- purchased markers Bottom - two week old expo I’ve been using.
customer_reviews.author: Brwnjj

customer_reviews.title: Great Colors for a Great Price
customer_reviews.text: I like used dry erase markers for a lot of different things and some tend to be plain in color and not work well. Expo markers have never disappointed me though and with the variety of colors I can color coordinate things. My only angst is the price as I wish it was lower; however, who doesn't want something at a cheaper price right? All-in-all, totally worth the purchase. **PRO TIP! - lay the markers flat when you store them and if not then tip side down to increase their longevity. They will last a lot longer this way because they do not evaporate as fast!**
customer_reviews.author: Peter Straka

customer_reviews.title: Markers work very well. A few of the brighter colors are a little hard to clean...
customer_reviews.text: I am completely happy and satisfied with these markers. They work well, and last. I have used them at work and in the past. They are bright, and work well. They don't erase as easily. They do not "stain", but they do require some effort to get clean. I use spray to help, but at times on cheap boards, these are hard to clean. I think it speaks to the quality of the markers, to the poor quality of boards. I do and will buy more of these in the future. The marks last for a long while with moderate use. This is a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: John F johnson

customer_reviews.title: Nice colors, decent saturation
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for use on a dry erase sign at work. Good color saturation, nice variety with some harder to find colors, decent line quality, good caps that stay on. Only complaint is no yellow included. Very happy. Edit: despite being closed completely and used evenly with the others, the bright blue has stopped working completely during the 3 months it sat unused in my office while I worked from home. No issues with any other colors.
customer_reviews.author: C.A. Tetley

customer_reviews.title: does not erase well
customer_reviews.text: Sure, it's low odor, but I thought the point of "dry erase" is that you can "erase" it easily. These leave a thin film on the board after erasing and tints the board to whatever color you were using. It also gums up the eraser. What's the effect of this? Plan to buy a lot more board cleaner and buy a 12 pack of erasers because each eraser will quickly become useless. Horrible. Never again.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Burch

customer_reviews.title: School supply list staple at great price
customer_reviews.text: This was THE best price and value for the 10+ markers I’m supposed to send with EACH kid when going back to school in a few weeks. Classic product that is the tried and true best when it comes to dry erase.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie M.

customer_reviews.title: Keep them stored cap down.
customer_reviews.text: I got these to replace others that were slowly dying out. We have white board calendars, note boards, and peel and stick whiteboard wallpaper for reminders (this is great. It doesn’t leave anything sticky and you just cut the amount you want off the roll.) They also write well on the bathroom mirrors if turned at the correct angle. Taking away one star because they do work much better if standing on cap and the box doesn’t say that. I have mine attached to the wall with command strips.
customer_reviews.author: C. McCullers

customer_reviews.title: Odor bothers me
customer_reviews.text: My preschoolers teacher recommended these dry erase markers to write on protective sheets, this way worksheets can be reused over and over to practice name, numbers and letters. It's a bright idea, but I have to say the odor is stronger than I expected and I'm not sure if we'll continue to use them. Color and ease of use is great though.
customer_reviews.author: Ivy Yang

customer_reviews.title: These did not last for me; do not wipe away cleanly
customer_reviews.text: I did not use these immediately, and when I finally pulled them out to use them a about 2 months after purchasing, they worked well the first time, and then dried out (wrote streaky lines instead of solid dark lines like they should have) very quickly. The red, although it wrote very cleanly and dark, it stained the whiteboard and doesn't wipe away cleanly. I have to clean it with dry-erase board spray after every use. I ended up just throwing it away, and wasting my money. I unfortunately won't be purchasing these again.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany White

customer_reviews.title: Great value and buy
customer_reviews.text: Got these as a lightning deal and love them. They write great on my white board and I love all the colors. They were a great price and will be perfect for my kids for at home learning.
customer_reviews.author: DMS

customer_reviews.title: Expo for classroom
customer_reviews.text: I love these dry erase...we used to get them for the classroom for the military but now have an other brand. I buy them so I can use them when I am teaching...I know they will last. Came as described and quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Whirlygirlmn

customer_reviews.title: Red ones don't work
customer_reviews.text: Most of the markers work fine. The red ones however, are really light pink when the color is put on the board. That color doesn't show up at all. I had to throw away all of the red ones. I wouldn't recommend buying the variety of colors, due to this issue. The black, blue, green and purple ones are fine.
customer_reviews.author: none1991

customer_reviews.title: Cheating product
customer_reviews.text: Very dry to begin with. Purposely filled with little ink to begin with. Do not understand why? Do not try you luck!
customer_reviews.author: Peter Teng

customer_reviews.title: Be careful
customer_reviews.text: Be careful, its a good price, maybe too good...... Some markers are faint. My red looks like a faint pink, and the pink marker wrote better and darker than the red. The other markers seem ok for now, but unhappy because I bought three boxes of the 8 pack and all 3 reds are not easily seen from my classroom students.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Dried Up After 6 weeks.
customer_reviews.text: I liked the price and the variety of colors. I disliked that 4 of the marks were completely dry after 6 weeks of occasional use. I contacted the seller and didn’t receive a response. I YouTubed a solution but was unable to pry the bottoms off to try and rejuvenate.
customer_reviews.author: wilsie herlihy

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy these markers.
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to buy these dry erasers to use in my classroom. I cycle through colors for the month, and I have found that at least HALF of the package is dried out and unusable. I really need to use the rest of the ones that work for my classroom, or I would try to return them. It is really frustrating to spend your own money as a teacher and have things not work properly. You would think that buying from Expo things would be a higher standard than this. DO NOT buy these markers. Try another seller.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Where’s the color??
customer_reviews.text: Terrible quality. All of the bold colors are nearly identical and almost black. There is no true color distinction. I have bought this same variety of colors multiple times, and never have the colors looked this way. They’re hideous. The other 4 markets seem fine, thankfully. I’d love a replacement pack from the merchant.
customer_reviews.author: Janie Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Made well but too hard to see
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these products to use on whiteboards at work. They are your typical Expo markers. They last well and don't dry out quickly. The biggest problem I have is with the colors themselves. The red, green, and blue markers all appear far too light on a whiteboard. They are difficult to see from anything further than maybe 5 feet away.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: Most were dry when arrived...
customer_reviews.text: I was really excited for this bundle since I use white board a lot for work and school. When I opened up the package (which was brand new) more than half of the markers were completely dry. I was soooo disappointed. I ordered during COVID-19, so it was too much of a hassle for me to send back. I won't be ordering these online again.
customer_reviews.author: victoria watson

customer_reviews.title: Very short lifespan
customer_reviews.text: The black hardly erases while the rest erase great. I mostly write in black with colored accents, and the black market ran out after writing a checklist on my 4’x4’ board less than 10 times. If you regularly use these markers, you might as well make them a weekly/daily subscription. I didn’t give 1 star only because they arrived the same day I ordered them, and they’re a good price for expo markers. (Even if the markers themselves aren’t very good).
customer_reviews.author: T

customer_reviews.title: Dried on arrival.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my wife because she is a teacher and needed them for the dry erase board I set up for her. When we tried to use them the purple was completely dry and would not write at all. More than half of them were almost dry and the colors were very faint. I got the Expo brand because they have always worked for us but this batch was garbage.
customer_reviews.author: SC

customer_reviews.title: Dries out so quickly
customer_reviews.text: We used them in the morning and left a couple with their cap open, when we came back in the evening one had completely dried out and the other was barely working. Recapping them didnt help them recover as they were still non functional the next day. Very disappointing. Dont know if this was an old stock that was already ready to dry out
customer_reviews.author: DR. DK

customer_reviews.title: Great pens
customer_reviews.text: I have a sensitivity to smells, so these low VOC pens are wonderful. We use them for Pictionary, and my granddaughters use them to draw freehand. I no longer have to tell them to take the white board to another room! The colors are vibrant, and varied, and I have two happy little girls. Who could ask for more?
customer_reviews.author: R Tuten

customer_reviews.title: I did NOT receive an "Assorted Color Pack"
customer_reviews.text: I'd have to go back to the add to see if there is a price difference for having an assorted color pack versus a all black pack, which matters to me. I am now a teacher trying to teach online, the assorted colors is important for my second language learners. I was sad when I opened the package to see an all black pack of markers. As of now, I do not have an option but to use what I I have received, it is better than nothing.
customer_reviews.author: Benita Barone

customer_reviews.title: brand new blue marker NO ink at all
customer_reviews.text: The blue marker was out of ink from the first moment I opened it. For "security reason" I can't even file a return. The other three pieces are doing good. I think it is a product quality control problem. Maybe they simple didn't fill in any ink in this blue piece. Unsatisfied.
customer_reviews.author: A.C.

customer_reviews.title: Great Expo Markers for the office!
customer_reviews.text: I got these for the boss. During every presentation, in between sentences- he'll stop and sniff the tips. Well, not this time buddy! These low-odor Expos are perfect to get through a meeting sooner. There's always the "I gotta poo!" while running out the door excuse & holding your butt, but that only works five times. Get these Expo Markers! Your time is worth it! Plus, the colors are a nice touch to any face that happens to be passed out!
customer_reviews.author: PocketGaming

customer_reviews.title: Very Satisfied
customer_reviews.text: I bought six packs of36-count Expo markers and gave markers to everyone in my office. The colors were bold, the markers work well. They do not smell up the cube environment. The only negative: The red markers do not erase as well as the other colors. The reds leave a pink shadow on our metal whiteboards that are built into our cubicles.
customer_reviews.author: Anne Marie Gosnell

customer_reviews.title: disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Was so excited to get these to use on my dry erase board. Loved the colors but some of them started beginning to fade on the board or the color was running out. After only two uses of like 20 minutes each time with various colors, they lost their vibrancy. The orange ran out quick and the green did too. I waited about 30 days or so to use them so now it's too late to return them.
customer_reviews.author: TG

customer_reviews.title: Work Great!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great pack of pens! I have a huge white board calendar in my hall that I like to decorate every month and having such a variety of colors is perfect! They write nice and thick and the colors come through bold. The colors shown are Pink, red, Orange, Green, Blue, Purplr, Brown and Black.
customer_reviews.author: Myrika

customer_reviews.title: Two of them didn't work.
customer_reviews.text: Two of the colors orange and brown did not work at all! I bought these to use for homeschooling and to find two of the colors didn't work was saddening. I tried to see if I could get a replacement but couldn't. I would suggest take into consideration that there might be a dud or two when you buy these markers.
customer_reviews.author: Judy S.

customer_reviews.title: NOT Returnable
customer_reviews.text: GREEN was very light and unusable out of the box. The issue is returns are not allowed because "This item isn't eligible for return. For safety reasons, items containing flammable liquids or gases can’t be returned to Amazon. For more information or help, please contact us." I by no means recommend ordering this product because if you get dry or very light markers out of the box it is basically your loss.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron I.

customer_reviews.title: decent!
customer_reviews.text: I am always reluctant to buy dry erase markers these days. These look decent. I teach online and it is important to have bold dark colors that the camera can pick up from 3 feet away. In this whole pack there werea couple that were dark enough for that, but the rest are sill good in general.
customer_reviews.author: Scooter

customer_reviews.title: Feels like kid markers nothing sexy or stylish about these markers
customer_reviews.text: As a teacher who uses these markers every day they work well, but there are better markers out there, I so dislike the had feel of the markers. I do not feel like I am writing, but drawing lines that make letters. No ergonomics made into these markers. Wish some of the lime greens, yellows were not in the pack. On smaller cheaper white boards the reds, do not wipe off easily if at all.
customer_reviews.author: V. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: These are my favorite dry erase markers
customer_reviews.text: These are my favorite dry erase markers! I've purchased some off brands before because I thought how different can they be? Well. like night and day. The off brands were a waste of money because my students could not see my writing on the whiteboard. I literally had to throw them away. Unfortunately, I have to share my classroom with other several other teachers who end up using my markers but do not keep the lids on tight or let the kids grind them into the board, etc... so, they do have to be replaced every couple of months. If you take care of these markers they will last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Home and Hearth

customer_reviews.title: Perfect, except for 1 minor issue
customer_reviews.text: These were just delivered maybe 5 minutes ago. I immediately opened them up to see if they were dried out, as so many other reviews explained. I did not find any of them dried out. All colors are plentiful and vibrant. The only "issue" I see is that the purple shade leaves "scratch marks" as it dries (picture to show what I mean). That is no big deal to me, might be a big deal to others. The colors erased nicely from my whiteboard. Hoping these last as long as my Expo markers have lasted in the past 🙂
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Terrible - paid for dried out markers.
customer_reviews.text: Terrible. Half will not write they are SO DRY. Red is so dry it will barely make a faint pink mark. Junk. Trash can. Green the same. Trash. Come on ! Black and Blue are okay, but pretty damn light. Expo typically makes good stuff. What the heck? Terrible.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Weddle

customer_reviews.title: Buy locally....these are junk.
customer_reviews.text: Waste of money. These come with watered down, dried up colors, especially the red. Not even useable. It’s a shame that I kept these in my desk drawer for three months before opening them because now I can’t return them. Complete waste of money. Buy these locally.
customer_reviews.author: S. VanhooseTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Would Purchase Again
customer_reviews.text: Good set of dry-erase markers at a good price. Some of the colors show up better than others - for example, the pink looks great, but the red looks very faded, even though I tried storing them tip-down. They erase cleanly and don't leave excess color on my whiteboard. I like the assortment of colors, but the blue and orange aren't quite as bright as in the picture (they're more your standard blue and orange, whereas in some of the pictures they look almost neon).
customer_reviews.author: A. Leigh Ford

customer_reviews.title: Piece of junk
customer_reviews.text: Please save yourself time and pass on those. They are complete junk out of the box. I did not read reviews ordering them but now that I did 100% agree. Besides, you can't return them because they consider to be "flammable". I am puzzled also why they have 5 star review while so many 1-stars ratings are out there. Oh, well, next time better read reviews
customer_reviews.author: puric

customer_reviews.title: Old Set of Markers
customer_reviews.text: I am so annoyed. I waiting too long to return these. Hard to remove and replace cap. Way too tight and the markers were dried out. Could have been a return from someone else or just a very old set. Huge waste of money. Never buy anything from Amazon and not check it out right then and there. This brand is awesome but this set in particular? Pissed!
customer_reviews.author: Tara Kamiya

customer_reviews.title: Dried out and impossible to erase
customer_reviews.text: I was honestly very disappointed in this product. I purchased this variety pack to use on my whiteboard while teaching. Unfortunately, some of these markers were dried out before I even got the opportunity to use them while the rest of them are nearly impossible to erase. I've used expo markers before with no problems at all and have never had this issue. I have absolutely no use for them as it's more of a hassle to use them then they're worth. I don't know if I happened to receive a bad batch or what, but I am extremely disappointed I wasted money on this product.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Scalfani

customer_reviews.title: markers
customer_reviews.text: They are just fine, black and brown show up the best. I use them on my school bus to wsite on the white board magnetic labels which are best ever. Principal was impressed with them as he came on bus was able to move them around himself, they were a little pricey for the bus but so much easier then stickers which don't and some labels which never come off again in spite of what was said about them, I still have glue from the backs stuck on top ledge of bus which is not impresssive
customer_reviews.author: Barb917

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality product, maybe they are old stock?
customer_reviews.text: Colors are very poor quality. First package I got was missing the black marker. Amazon did respond quickly and send another set of markers because the item was non-returnable. I was able to make a half decent set from the 2. But they all do seem of poor quality, some just barely work at all. But I need them and will use them, at least its just me who will need to look at the board. I have bought this item from the store before with a lot better results.
customer_reviews.author: Smozk

customer_reviews.title: Bright sharp colors
customer_reviews.text: I really like these markers, I use them on my whiteboard calendar to help keep track of all my classes they don’t dry out as long as you make sure you close the cap properly (just make sure you hear the click when closing) they don’t leave any smudge or color behind and I leave it on my board for a month
customer_reviews.author: Raja salar

customer_reviews.title: They dry out fast and some are difficult to erase
customer_reviews.text: These are ok, but they dry out super fast, and the yellow ones (not in this package, but this brand) don’t show up well. I mean, what’s the point in even making them. Also, the pink marker is very difficult to erase. I’ve discovered that Big Lots makes dry erase markers that are much more vivid and easy to erase too.
customer_reviews.author: Music Lover

customer_reviews.title: Works OK, not Great on Glass Boards
customer_reviews.text: I purchased for our new white painted glass boards at our office. After reading countless reviews for dry erase markers I went with name brand since it's for professional use. As is typical, not all colors show up well but most do. They leave a greasy residue behind when you wipe them off. Hard to capture in the pictures. I bought the jumbo pack to sprinkle in some color with black markers in everyone's office so this will suffice.
customer_reviews.author: EM Admin

customer_reviews.title: Fun set but bright colors are hard to see
customer_reviews.text: A great set. Features two of the primary colors (red, blue, black, green) and the rest are fun colors. We scored these on prime day for a steal and used the primary colors to donate to the teachers for back to school. I kept the fun colors but some of them are really light so you can't see them. For the price I paid I don't mind but at regular price I would have been unhappy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very happy!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased the 16pack. Great price, quality and variety of colors. Not sure why there were so many negative reviews?
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia Rojas

customer_reviews.title: Low Odor
customer_reviews.text: These are exactly what I needed for my classroom. They are low odor compared to the regular ones and the chisel tip helps writing fine print and coloring in. They last very long too and erase easily. If this review was helpful, please click 'Helpful' at the bottom of the review. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: mick04u

customer_reviews.title: Grab them up!
customer_reviews.text: GREAT FOR THE PRICE!!! Was delivered on time! Great for teaching my kids on the expo board! Definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Brittany Ayers

product_meta.title: Expo Low Odor Dry Erase Marker, Chisel Tip Markers, Whiteboard Markers, Assorted, 36 Count
product_meta.description: Size:36 Count (Pack of 1)| Color:Multicolor| Product Packaging:Standard PackagingExpo Low Odor Dry Erase Markers feature vivid ink that’s easy to see from a distance and provides consistent color quality. These chisel tip dry erase markers erase cleanly and easily from whiteboards and other nonporous surfaces with a dry cloth or Expo eraser. The dry erase marker ink is specially formulated to be low odor, making it perfect for use in classrooms, home school, and offices. Use your colorful Expo dry erase markers to track, schedule, and present.
feature_bullets: Consistent, skip free marking and brilliant color options
Low odor ink formula erases cleanly and is ideal for classrooms, offices and home offices
Versatile chisel tip allows for broad or fine writing
For optimal results, use on non porous surfaces such as porcelain or melamine whiteboards and glass
Box of 36 includes a mix of black, green, red, purple and blue dry erase markers

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars9,496 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
